result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose A Nery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision dhall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain/maintain full time employment/school or a combination of both.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting
No possession of any firearms or weapons; including brass knuckle or fire ammunition.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant may not possess any digital scales.
Defendant may not possess cash greater that $200 at any one time.
No contact with any gang or gang member.
No new tattoos.
No contact with the property at 1238 S 26th street, Milwaukee, Wisconsin. May not go within the parameter of W.Scott Street on the North side, W. Greenfield on the South side, on S. 27th street also known as S. Lyton Boulevard on the West side, and S. 24th Street on the East side.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol.
Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. Court recommends Trauma Informed Mental Health treatment.
Court prohibtis contact with Mark R., Roberto B., Elvira S., Juan S., and Antonio S. during confinement and during Extended Supervision. 
Restitution to both Elvira S. and Roberto B. is set at $0
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose A Nery in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Jose A Nery in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Elvira S. 
Aim report received by parties. PSI reviewed by parties. Statements made as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 1: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 2, with credit for 306 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  

Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant incarcerated for a total of 6 MONTHS, concurrent to COUNT 1, with credit for 306 days time served. 

Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons; including brass knuckle or fire ammunition. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
- Obtain/Maintain Full Time employment/school or a combination of both. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment. Court recommends Trauma Informed         
  Mental Health Treatment. 
- Defendant may not possess any digital scales. 
- Defendant  may not possess cash greater than $200 at any one time. 
- No contact with any gang or gang member. 
- No new tattoos. 
- No contact with the property at 1238 S. 26th Street, Milwaukee, Wisconsin.
  May not go within the parameter of W. Scott Street on the North side, W. Greenfield on the South side, 
  on S. 27th Street also known as S. Layton Boulevard on the West side, and S. 24th Street on the East 
  side. 
- Court prohibits contact with Mark R., Roberto B., Elvira S., Juan S., and Antonio S. during confinement and during Extended Supervision.
- Restitution to both Elvira S. and Roberto B. is set at $0.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 8/26/2014 at 8:30 am.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Jose A Nery not in court, in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Court is currently in trial and not able to get to the sentencing.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.
Oral No Contact Order with Elvira S, Juan S, Antonio S, Roberto B or the address of 1238 South 26th Street, Milwaukee, WI.

As to Count 1 and Amended Count 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the orally amended Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Defense will be ordering a private PSI, State is asking for a PSI without sentencing recommendation.  Order for Presentence Investigation received and filed; copy to Probation Dept.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 15.

Defendant Jose A Nery in court with attorney Douglas J Rebholz.  Defendant Jose A Nery in custody.  Denis Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  On motion of the State, Court ordered Count 2 amended to possession of THC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(3g)(e), an unclassified misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
